meanings.definition: Of, relating to, or inserted as a parenthesis.
meanings.sent1: The parenthetic information in the sentence was extra and not necessary for the main point.
meanings.sent2: She added a parenthetic comment about the weather at the end of her email.
meanings.sent3: The parenthetic note about his favorite food made everyone chuckle.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like a parenthetic ray of sunshine on a cloudy day.
meanings.sent5: The teacher used a parenthetic example to clarify the concept for the students.

meanings.sent1: I always enjoy reading the parenthetic comments in books; they add extra insight.
meanings.sent2: The parenthetic in the article provided background information for the readers.
meanings.sent3: His speech was full of parenthetic remarks that kept the audience engaged.
meanings.sent4: The parenthetic in the conversation acted like a small pause for reflection.
meanings.sent5: The parenthetic at the end of the paragraph summarized the main idea succinctly.
